devdoc.details: Integrates Pyth Network price feeds with LayerZero OFT bridging

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

params.amount: Amount of OFT tokens to bridge
params.expiryDuration: How long the order is valid (in seconds, 0 for no expiry)
params.priceFeedId: Pyth price feed ID to monitor

executeOrder(uint256,bytes[]).details: Anyone can call this (keeper/bot), executor gets a small reward

params.priceUpdate: Pyth price update data (fetch from Hermes API)

params.orderId: Order ID to mark as expired

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: ConditionalBridge

cancelOrder(uint256).notice: Cancel a pending order and return tokens to user

checkOrderCondition(uint256).notice: Check if order condition is currently met (view function)

executeOrder(uint256,bytes[]).notice: Execute a bridge order when price condition is met

getCurrentPrice(bytes32).notice: Get current price from Pyth feed

userdoc.notice: Enables automated token bridging when price conditions are met
